trait.name: Sentinel
entries: When the highknight hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creatureâ€™s speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn. Creatures provoke attacks of opportunity from the highknight  even if they use the {@action Disengage} action before leaving the highknight's reach.

trait.name: Death Before Dishonor
entries: The Purple Dragon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The highknight makes three melee attacks with its greatsword or two ranged attacks with its heavy crossbow (ignoring the loading property).

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the highknight can utter a command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll, provided it can hear and understand the highknight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the highknight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Bodyguard
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of the Purple Dragon is hit by an attack roll, the Purple Dragon may use its reaction to force the attacking creature to reroll their attack, potentially causing it to miss. To use this ability, the Purple Dragon must be able to see both the creature and its attacker.
